Award.AbstractNarration:
Penguin: A Film

Penguin is a feature-length natural history film, produced in conjunction with DisneyNature, for release on Earth Day 2019. Produced by the team that made Frozen Planet, the Penguin film will be an in-depth documentary of the life-cycle of the Adelie penguin. The goal is to explore the fascinating behaviors of this particular species (Pygoscelis adeliae) within the context of the broader ecosystem of the Antarctic continent.

While there have been other highly successful and popular films about penguins, this will be the first to focus on the Adelie population. The majority of filming will be in and around the penguin colony of Cape Crozier. The end product will be the first feature length documentary on Antarctic wildlife to be created in 4K, and the resulting footage will constitute the largest 4K film archive of the Ross Sea. The film will be complemented by an extensive Educator's Guide made readily available to teachers in grades 2-6 across the country, and a separate parent activity pack in English and Spanish. Beyond the theaters, the film will be distributed on DVD and Blu-ray for years to come. NSF is providing the filmmakers logistic support only.

POR.DRECONTENT:
Penguins is a feature length documentary on Adelie Penguins for Disneynature, to be released in 2019 . The project succesfully documented the breeding lifecycle of Adelie's as Cape Crozier and Cape Royds over two seasons , as well as documented the broader ecology of the Ross Sea through filming Orca's and scenics from helicopters . The film is designed to entertain audiences whilst helping them understand the biology of the Adelie penguins that live in Antarctica .

The crew mainly worked in ASPA 124 on foot filming with 6k RED cameras and long lens technology , and  adapted stabilised platforms specifically to detail penguin behaviour in new ways . Breeding behaviour , interactions with other species ( Skua, Leopard Seal, Wedell Seal , Orca) , chick raising were all part of the remit , and will be shown to audiences in new and exciting ways .

The film team worked succesfully alongside scientific teams at Crozier and in McMurdo Sound, and will be supplying additional media to them to promote their outreach objectives for the science projects .

The aim of the project is to bring audiences to the beauty and importance of Adelie penguins to the Antarctic continent whilst inspiring a new generation of naturalists which can continue caryring the mantle of the important work being done from the USAP bases .
